importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the article's update, indicating when the public was informed that former President Biden completed a course of radiation therapy.
The date when Biden's personal office confirmed he had been diagnosed with an aggressive form of prostate cancer that had spread to his bones.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The period during which Biden underwent diagnosis, radiation therapy, and related treatments, illustrating a timeline of his cancer journey.

keyTakeAways: Former President Joe Biden completed a full course of radiation therapy for prostate cancer, a significant milestone in his treatment journey.
The radiation therapy followed an earlier diagnosis of an aggressive form of prostate cancer that had spread to his bones, as confirmed by his personal office in May 2025.
Biden had also undergone Mohs surgery for skin cancer earlier in the year, indicating a broader cancer treatment timeline.
Biden's daughter Ashley shared a video and photo celebrating the completion of radiation therapy, emphasizing gratitude to medical staff and expressing pride in his bravery.
The public is still uncertain about future treatment steps, as no details were provided by Biden’s spokesperson.
Despite his health challenges, Biden is scheduled to speak at events in Boston and Omaha, showing his continued public engagement.
The incident highlights the intersection of political leadership and personal health, drawing global attention to the transparency and visibility of cancer treatments in high-profile individuals.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Former President Joe Biden has completed a full course of radiation therapy as part of his treatment for aggressive prostate cancer that had spread to his bones. He began a pill regimen earlier in the year and had previously undergone Mohs surgery for skin cancer. His daughter Ashley publicly celebrated the completion of treatment with a video and photo, expressing gratitude to medical staff and highlighting his courage. While the exact next steps in treatment remain unclear, Biden remains active in public life, with scheduled appearances in Boston and Omaha. The article underscores the intersection of political leadership and personal health, drawing global attention to the transparency and resilience of high-profile individuals facing serious medical conditions.
title: Biden completes a course of radiation therapy for cancer treatment
